physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Thickened wet rales in both lungs, abdominal distention, bilateral lower limb edema, neurological examination negative with Glasgow Coma Scale score of 15/15.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure fell dramatically to 84/58 mmHg four days after admission; subsequently, Glasgow Coma Scale decreased to 3/15 on day 14.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Laboratory findings show stable blood pressure at 120/73 mmHg with significant elevation in inflammatory markers and renal function decline.
